From the campground gate, take a left and ride down the campground access road. At the main road, there is a grass, bike-able path on the left. This will take you across a portion of the dam to the Hartwell COE Headquarters. The paved path begins behind the headquarters and goes all the way to the power generation plant on the main dam. The total ride is about 3.5 miles round trip.

trails.description: There are more than 3 miles of paved trails in the park. There are also 10 miles of soft trails in the park. campground.name: Marysville City Park

campground.info: Marysville City Park. 6 sites with basic RV or tent needs. Free.

trails.description: Blue River Rail Trail. This trail begins in downtown Marysville at the bronze Pony Express Statue. The first three blocks are unfinished, followed by three blocks along 7th street. At that point, the trail continues as a crushed limestone trail. It continues for about 13 miles to the Nebraska state line. There it continues as the Chief Standing Bear Trail to Beatrice and eventually it continues as the Homestead Trail in Lincoln.
trails.name: Chief Standing Bear Trail to Beatrice and eventually it continues as the Homestead Trail

campground.name: Kentucky Horse Park Campground

trails.description: There is a network of bike trails in the area including the Frazer Creek Bike Path and the Wonsqueak Bike Path.

trails.description: Cape Cod Canal
The park has access to the Cape Cod Canal Pathway. This is a 7.5 mile (one way) paved trail

The distance from the campground to the paved bike trail is about 1.1 mile. The town of Salem has additional paved bike trails.

The Pere Marquette Trail is a 30 mile paved trail. The White Pine Trail State Park is a 92 mile linear trail, most of which is asphalt.

campground.info: Lincoln State Park in Lincoln City, Indiana. Partial Hooks. Bike Ride: The state park is located across the street from the Lincoln Boyhood National Memorial. trails.description: The campground is located very near the Greenbrier entrance of Great Smoky Mountains National Park. One can ride the back roads from the campground to the Greenbrier entrance and then on the park road for a total ride of about eleven miles. Read my blog post about our ride in Great Smoky Mountains National Park here.

entries.exception: Exception: There's no trail. Gatlinburg, TN
